title: Cannot match pattern in Enum variant
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

This works:

```rust
enum Variant {
    VarOne(i32),
    VarTwo(i32),
}

fn func(variant: Variant) {
    match variant {
        VarOne => {
                // ...
        },
        VarTwo => {
                // ...
        }
    }
}
```

This does not work:

```rust
enum Variant {
    VarOne(i32),
    VarTwo(i32),
}

fn func(variant: Variant) {
    match variant {
        VarOne => {
                // ...
        },
        VarTwo(e) => { // <- match `e`
                // ...
        }
    }
}
```

Results in:

```bash
error[E0531]: cannot find tuple struct or tuple variant `VarTwo` in this scope
  --> src/lib.rs:11:9
   |
11 |         VarTwo(e) => {
   |         ^^^^^^ not found in this scope
   |
help: possible candidate is found in another module, you can import it into scope
   |
1  | use crate::core::processor::Variant::VarTwo;
   |
```

Additional details:

* When you write the full identifier, it works: `Variant::VarTwo(e) => {`
* Trying to import the variants with `use Variant::*;` results in error (which does not make much sense):
```bash
error[E0530]: match bindings cannot shadow tuple variants
  --> src/lib.rs:10:9
   |
1  | use Variant::*;
   |     ---------- the tuple variant `VarOne` is imported here
...
10 |         VarOne => {
   |         ^^^^^^ cannot be named the same as a tuple variant

```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.44.0 (49cae5576 2020-06-01)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 49cae55760da0a43428eba73abcb659bb70cf2e4
commit-date: 2020-06-01
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.44.0
LLVM version: 9.0
```
